messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> What are you afraid might break here?
>
> Most of my exception classes are immutable value objects that don't care
> if they're passed null through the constructor, so there's nothing to
> test that the compiler isn't already testing.

My exception classes may be more complicated than yours. I generally
have at least two constructors, including one that takes a root cause.
Typically I try to give my constructors correct exception chaining
functionality in both Java 1.3 and earlier and Java 1.4 and later.
Getting that right is tricky since you have to override several methods
with detailed and weird semantics. One example can be found at

http://cvs.jaxen.codehaus.org/viewrep/jaxen/jaxen/src/java/main/org/jaxen/JaxenException.java

Look at versions 1.7 through 1.12. There were several bug fixes along
the way, all of which had to be tested with unit tests.
